intro: Chlamysporum multiflorum, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange or red petals and is part of the Papaveraceae family. The plant has a low-growing, herbaceous structure with lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. The California poppy is also known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a symbol of the state of California.
